unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Six-Sided Dice Rolls
question_text: Number on Die 1 2 3 4 5 6 Frequency 9 17 12 10 9 15 A fair six-sided die is rolled $72\text{ times}$ . The distribution of numbers facing up on the dice is in the table above. If the die is rolled another $72\text{ times}$ , how many instances of $2$ would you expect?
